title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 21 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The launch includes 13 Starlink V2 Mini satellites that have Direct to Cell capabilities. Liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is set for 11:21 a.m. EST (1621 UTC).

title: Why are wildfires raging across Southern California? Well, it’s complicated.
summary: "I think we’ve got more questions than answers at this point."

title: NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory evacuated due to LA wildfire
summary:
The NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory has been closed down and evacuated as the Eaton Fire continues to burn, at its closest, less than one mile away from the facility.
The post NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory evacuated due to LA wildfire appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Rubicon delivers  propulsion for NASA dual-mode mission
summary:
Rubicon Space Systems built the multimode propulsion system for a NASA mission scheduled to launch in October.

title: SpaceX confirms next Starship launch target – Here’s when it will take off
summary:
SpaceX has confirmed a new target date for the seventh Starship test launch after weather in Texas delayed the first scheduled date for “three or four days.” The company is now targeting the launch for Monday, January 13, at 4 p.m. CST or 5 p.m. EST. The launch date is not set in stone as […]
The post SpaceX confirms next Starship launch target – Here’s when it will take off appeared first on TESLARATI.

summary:

title: Summary of the 2024 NASA LCLUC Science Team Meeting
summary: Introduction The 2024 NASA Land-Cover and Land-Use Change (LCLUC) Science Team Meeting (STM) took place from April 2–4, 2024 at the Marriott Washingtonian Center in Gaithersburg, MD. During the meeting, 75 people attended in-person. Represented among the attendees were LCLUC project investigators and collaborators, NASA Headquarters (HQ) program managers, and university researchers and students – […]

title: Researchers propose UN goal to curb space debris
summary:
Countries must unite to include space stewardship in the United Nations’ sustainable development goals to address an escalating threat of orbital debris, an international group of scientists and other experts warned.
The post Researchers propose UN goal to curb space debris appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: 35 Years Ago: STS-32 Returns the Long Duration Exposure Facility
summary: On Jan. 9, 1990, space shuttle Columbia took off on its ninth flight, STS-32, from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center (KSC) in Florida. Its five-person crew of Commander Daniel Brandenstein, Pilot James Wetherbee, and Mission Specialists Bonnie Dunbar, Marsha Ivins, and David Low flew a then record-breaking 11-day mission to deploy the Syncom IV-F5 communications satellite […]
